Comment: Jesus had a philosophy of how humans should treat each other.  He actively taught it when he was alive.  If you don't believe in God or the supernatural, there are still his teachings on how humans should behave towards one another.  These are guidelines for how a person should live their life.  One of America's founders, Thomas Jefferson (a Christian Deist who didn't believe God was active in the world anymore), even created his own version of the Bible that cut out all the supernatural parts leaving only Jesus' philosophical teachings.  It's called "The Life and Morals of Jesus of Nazareth".  Some people need the threat of supernatural punishment to do the right thing; others try to do the right thing because it's the right thing.  In the same way you aren't a scientist if you don't practice science, you aren't a Christian if you don't follow Jesus teachings - you're just a label on an empty suit.
